title: My Child Does Soroban But Math Grades Are Still Low – Why?
description: Months of soroban practice, but school math scores haven't improved. Here's what might be happening and what to do.
imageAlt: Child with soroban and low math test score

content.intro: My son has been doing soroban for 6 months. He's good at it – fast calculations, high accuracy in the app. But his school math grades? Still C's. What's going on?

sections.text: If your child's low grades are in word problems, geometry, or fractions – soroban won't directly help those areas. It helps the calculation WITHIN those problems, but not the problem-solving itself.
Modern math tests emphasize reasoning, explanation, and problem-solving. Pure calculation might be only 20-30% of the grade.
Your child might be great at soroban in a relaxed environment but freezes during timed tests. That's not a soroban problem; it's an anxiety problem.
Some teachers want specific methods shown. If your child uses soroban methods but the teacher wants "show your work" with traditional algorithms, they might lose points.
6 months is good, but transfer to school math can take 6-12 months. The mental math benefits need time to translate to test performance.

items: **Identify the gap:** Look at actual tests. Where are points lost?
**Address specific weaknesses:** Word problems? Practice those separately.
**Keep soroban going:** The benefits compound over time
**Manage expectations:** Soroban helps arithmetic, not all of math

sections.text: Soroban is building a foundation. Even if grades don't reflect it yet, the number sense and calculation speed will help increasingly as math gets harder.

faq.question: Should I stop soroban if grades aren't improving?
faq.answer: Not necessarily. Ask what's causing the low grades. If it's calculation, keep going. If it's word problems or concepts, address those separately.

faq.question: How long until I see grade improvement?
faq.answer: Varies widely. Some kids show improvement in 3 months, others in a year. Consistency matters more than timeline.

faq.question: Is soroban a waste of time if grades don't improve?
faq.answer: No. Soroban builds skills that benefit math long-term, even if short-term grades don't reflect it. The foundation matters.

cta.text: Keep building that foundation. Mental math skills last a lifetime.
